content.text:
List of games I've been playing, roughly based on [frecency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frecency):

- [The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Elder_Scrolls_III%3A_Morrowind), a deep and sprawling role-playing game I grew up playing *way* too much
- [Command & Conquer: Red Alert 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Command_%26_Conquer%3A_Red_Alert_2), a silly real-time strategy game with a Cold War theme
- [Age of Empires III](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Age_of_Empires_III)
- [Counter Strike](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Counter-Strike_%28video_game%29)
- [America's Army 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/America%27s_Army#America's_Army_2_2), blatant USAF military propaganda that I originally fell for
- [The Elders Scrolls V: Skyrim](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Elder_Scrolls_V:_Skyrim)
- [Tom Clancy's Rainbox Six Siege](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom_Clancy%27s_Rainbow_Six_Siege)
- [Apex Legends](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apex_Legends), a ridiculous battle royale game I've been playing with [@bram](@eWOvcKppzZfzr04jpftrvwOUCzF847PQZ942hI3FCsI=.ed25519) lately
